executive_summary: The Data Recovery Services industry in the United States salvages computer files from damaged, failed, corrupted or inaccessible storage media. Although the increasing number of households with at least one computer and the rising popularity of electronic devices were expected to provide ample demand for industry services, options for data recovery and data loss prevention have expanded in recent years, and demand for industry services has declined. Over the five years to 2020, industry revenue is estimated to fall an annualized 9.5% to $9.1 million, with an expected decline of 14.2% in 2020 alone, accelerated by the effects of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Furthermore, profit is expected to contract sharply to a period low as well due to increased price competition and poor macroeconomic conditions caused by the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Technological developments created the need for the Data Recovery Services industry in the United States, and continuous changes in technology have rendered the industry largely superfluous, leading to its gradual demise for over a decade.

As options for data recovery and data loss prevention or backup have expanded over the five years to 2020, demand for industry services has declined. As a result, over the five years to 2020, industry revenue will decrease at an annualized rate of 9.5% to $9.1 million.
Despite the expanding potential market for industry services, external competition from recovery and backup software has shifted demand away from the industry over the past decade.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's contraction is forecast to continue over the five years to 2025. Revenue is anticipated to decline an annualized 8.0% to $6.0 million over the five years to 2025.

The latest threat to the industry is the growing prevalence of online data storage, otherwise known as cloud computing. Cloud computing enables users to store files on remote servers that are accessible from any computer or mobile device.
Such negative competitive factors will trump positive demand drivers over the next five years, anticipated to push down the number of industry operators and overall profit.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide data recovery services. Data recovery is the process of salvaging data from damaged, failed, corrupted or inaccessible storage media when it cannot be accessed normally.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses in all fields, including financial, medical, manufacturing, retail and other types of businesses account for the majority of industry revenue at 78.7%. Small- and medium-sized businesses tend to seek out more data recovery services than larger companies that have internal information technology departments that can manage data loss. Smaller businesses may seek out data recovery services when information such as client information or sales data has been lost. Non-profit entities account for a small, but expanding segment of industry revenue as well, as more digital data is required for their operations, while older record are more likely to need to be archived for legal reasons from this segment.

Individuals that lose valuable data or files of sentimental value, such as photos, may seek out data recovery services to retrieve lost or damaged data files. Consumers may store valuable data files including photos, digital media

Government related work in forensic analysis for crime investigation often uses data recovery services to retrieve missing or destroyed data. Forensic investigators use data recovery services to acquire evidence of digital crime or other forms evidence for court cases. This segment is expected to have grown the fastest over the past five years, and will likely experience more-steady demand comparatively in 2020 in light of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, as government spending has slowed less rapidly than business spending.

Non-profit entities account for a small, but expanding segment of industry revenue as well, as more digital data is required for their operations, while older record are more likely to need to be archived for legal reasons from this segment.

products_and_services.product_description: Recovering data from physically damaged hardware can be done by replacing parts in the hard disk, recovering lost data from dropped, damaged, corrupted and traumatized drives. During the data recovery process, engineers disassemble data storage devices, inspect them for physical damage and perform component-level repair. A specialized disk-imaging procedure is used to recover readable parts from the surface of the disk. The image is acquired and saved on a separate medium.

The most common data recovery services are used for operating system failure. Data recovery technicians mount the system drive and back up disks and move the files from the system disk to the backup media with file manager software. Some data recovery services are requested when there is a disk-level failure, such as a compromised file system or disk partition or hard disk failure. Data recovery technicians can repair the file system and use software-based recovery of corrupted data.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The rapid introduction of new technology heavily influences demand for data recovery services. Changes in data storage, including cloud computing, have reduced the utility of industry services. Cloud computing poses a major threat to the industry as cloud services can constantly save and back up data on servers to prevent data loss. New technology has also made backup hard drives much more efficient and affordable. Computers can be set up to constantly copy and back up data to be sent wired or wirelessly to an external hard drive which safely stores the data. As the price of hard drives used for backup falls, demand for data recovery services will fall.

With increasing internet traffic and a rising number of mobile internet connections, an increasing number of services are offered online. This trend creates more and more data, including shopping habits, internet-surfing habits, information preferences and much more, stored and organized across ever-growing data centers. Although the increasing amount of data should logically stimulate industry demand, the popularization of cloud computing that provides online storage of data is providing a serious threat to the industry.

Demand for data recovery services is not particularly influenced by general economic conditions. Poor economic do not usually influence demand for industry services as industry services are considered necessary and not discretionary for both households and businesses. However, the travel limitations caused by the COVID-19 pandemic are expected to lead to the steepest revenue decline of the five-year period in 2020, hampering potential revenue from brick-and-mortar operators that specialize in hardware repairs or depend on walk-in foot traffic.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Data Recovery Services industry in the United States primarily provides service to US households and companies. Due to the service-oriented nature of the industry, it does not engage in international trade. These repairs are time-critical and required on-site, limiting opportunities for imports and exports. The availability of low-cost local skills and transport costs also act as a deterrent against international trade in the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region of the United States accounts for the highest percentage of industry establishments at 24.0% and population at 38.0%. The Southeast region holds a smaller share of revenue compared with establishments due to high competition. With several companies in the area offering similar services, operators have to compete on price, thus lowering revenue.

The West accounts for 22.0% of industry establishments and holds 23.0% of the US population. California accounts for the largest number of establishments and revenue in the region due to the concentration of high-tech information technologies companies.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The most significant is the ISO 9002, a quality assurance model made up of quality system requirements that is applicable to organizations that produce, install and service all types of products.

Additionally, a certification, such as IACRB's Certified Data Recovery Professional, ensures that a technician has fundamental knowledge of data recovery, skills to successfully recover data from damaged or partially destroyed hard drives, solid state media and removable media.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The primary barrier to entering the Data Recovery Services industry in the United States is finding employees that have hardware and software skills related to data recovery.
New entrants need to have a strong knowledge of niche markets, technical expertise and financial resources to build a viable sales base.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators generally compete on the basis of location, convenience, price, quality of repairs and speed of service.
Experience and reputation are important as customers seek to find a reputable electronic and data recovery service provider.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Data Recovery Services industry in the United States is highly fragmented and dominated by small operators.
The largest companies in the industry each account for less than 5.0% of industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages account for a significant proportion of expenses for the industry, representing 29.8% of industry expenses in 2020. Overall wage declines have been driven by increasing technological change in data recovery techniques.
Purchases account for 6.8% of revenue in 2020. Data recovery services may replace customer's hardware and software to offer effective services.
Over the five years to 2020, depreciation expenses have declined as companies have ceased large investments in upgrading facilities and equipment in light of declining industry revenue.

Marketing costs are expected to increase over the five years to 2020. Companies have attempted to lure more customers by increasing their advertising campaigns in light of the industry's structural decline.
Rent is expected to account for 3.5% of revenue in 2020, with companies in urban areas typically incurring higher costs.
Utilities are expected to account for 1.0% of industry revenue in 2020.
Other spending, which includes research and development, administrative services and professional business and financial fees, represents an estimated 46.6% of industry revenue in 2020.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Data Recovery Services industry in the United States experiences a low level of capital intensity. Using wages as a proxy for labor and depreciation as a proxy for capital, for every dollar spent on labor, an estimated $0.05 is spent on capital, indicating a highly labor-intensive service.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Data Recovery Services industry in the United States exhibits a low level of revenue volatility, largely due to the consistently rapid pace at which revenue has fallen over the past five years.
Data recovery services are not highly sensitive to changes in business cycles and household income as data retrieval services are considered a necessary, not discretionary, expense.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Data Recovery Services industry has been decimated by technological disruption. Increasingly, the industry's services have been rendered obsolete as a result of cloud computing, or online data storage.

The rate of technological change for the Data Recovery Services industry in the United States is high. Industry companies use new software for data recovery and must use innovative solutions for data retrieval, processing, management and review.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Industry companies must work with new technologies
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Data recovery technicians must constantly update and retrieve data from operating systems such as Microsoft Windows, Apple and Google devices and Linux. In addition, digital storage technology is constantly shifting.

More consumers are using data backup services to prevent the need for data recovery services. Many technology businesses now use dedicated servers that constantly backup data onto a separate medium to prevent data loss.

FAQs.question: Have shifting consumer preferences presented an opportunity/threat to your company's growth prospects?
FAQs.answer: The shift to online and digital services has deteriorated demand for industry services over the past two decades.

FAQs.question: Does your company face significant competition from substitute goods or services?
FAQs.answer: Due to the high level of competition from online services and cloud computing, there is consistent competition that has undermined demand for data recovery services.

FAQs.question: How has your company minimized costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies have minimized costs by contracting work, which has helped to minimize costs as many services can be performed online.

FAQs.question: How do your depreciation and R&D spending levels compare with your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger businesses typically dedicate more resources to development and capital expenditures, and are therefore often higher in real terms but lower as a percentage of revenue because of the cost savings of economies of scale.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, particularly as it pertains to data storage, computing power and other factors?
FAQs.answer: Data storage is crucial because it can eliminate many of the barriers that are associated with larger projects while centralizing operations instead of fragmenting the process.

FAQs.question: How have software advances altered your company's operations?
FAQs.answer: Software advances have given data processors better ways to recover data to better serve their clients.

FAQs.question: Over the past five years, has the regulatory environment changed significantly, or has it remained relatively stable?
FAQs.answer: Regulation continues to play a large role in day-to-day operations. It is of the utmost importance to understand and effectively navigate the regulatory environment to stay ahead of competition.

FAQs.question: How does your company comply with regulatory requirements?
FAQs.answer: Purchasing licenses and ensuring equipment and service is up to date and performing at the regulatory standard require both capital and labor force investment.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare with those of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Because of the declining nature of the industry, profit margins have eroded in recent years. Price-based competition has also pressured margins over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Have your company's profit margins moved in line with your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Generally, for companies of the same size, profit margins move in tandem across the industry because prices are dictated by competition and demand.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Companies in the industry use software that reads data from a variety of sources such as text, audio and images. As native file formats change, industry operators will need to update software.

FAQs.question: What does your recruiting process entail? How do you train and develop your staff?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators must hire knowledgeable data recovery technicians to address the different types of problems that are involved in data loss.

FAQs.question: Have you invested heavily in automation? What affect does automation have on your profit margins?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that can automate the data recovery process can benefit from reduced expenses in labor.

FAQs.question: Do you conduct any of your services online? How do you plan to mitigate this threat?
FAQs.answer: Data recovery services endure intense external competition from including data recovery and backup software, online storage services such as cloud computing and technological advancements that enable potential customers to recover data without assistance.

FAQs.question: How often do you invest in new technologies and computer equipment? Do you see an increase in demand when doing so?
FAQs.answer: Businesses are a major market for data recovery services; therefore, the level of their investment in software is a valuable indicator of this industry's performance.

FAQs.question: Do you find revenue trends to be in line with the number of mobile internet connections? How does that affect your demand?
FAQs.answer: As the number of mobile internet connections increases in 2018, more consumers will back up their data through the internet and consequently limit demand for industry operators.
